text: The United States Secretary of Education is the head of the Department of Education. The Secretary is a member of the President's Cabinet, and 16th in line of United States presidential line of succession. The United States Secretary of Education deals with Education. In 1979, President Jimmy Carter established the Department of Education as a cabinet-level agency. Previously, Education had been handled by the Secretary of Health, Education, and Welfare, henceforth known as the Secretary of Health and Human Services. ==Chronological list== Source No. Portrait Name State of residence Took office Left office President President California November 30, 1979 January 20, 1981 (1977–1981) Utah January 22, 1981 January 20, 1985 (1981–1989) North Carolina February 6, 1985 September 20, 1988 (1981–1989) North Carolina February 6, 1985 September 20, 1988 (1981–1989) Texas September 20, 1988 December 12, 1990 (1981–1989) Texas September 20, 1988 December 12, 1990 (1989–1993) – Illinois December 12, 1990 March 22, 1991 (1989–1993) Tennessee March 22, 1991 January 20, 1993 (1989–1993) South Carolina January 21, 1993 January 20, 2001 (1993–2001) Texas January 20, 2001 January 20, 2005 (2001–2009) Texas January 20, 2005 January 20, 2009 (2001–2009) Illinois January 21, 2009 January 1, 2016 (2009–2017) New York January 1, 2016 March 14, 2016 (2009–2017) New York March 14, 2016 January 20, 2017 (2009–2017) – Virginia January 20, 2017 February 7, 2017 (2017–2021) Michigan February 7, 2017 January 8, 2021 (2017–2021) – South Carolina January 8, 2021 January 20, 2021 (2017–2021) – Virginia January 20, 2021 March 2, 2021 (2021–2025) Connecticut March 2, 2021 January 20, 2025 (2021–2025) – January 20, 2025 March 3, 2025 (2025–present) Linda McMahon Connecticut March 3, 2025 Incumbent (2025–present) ==References== Secretary of Education * Category:1979 establishments in the United States
